name: Casa Grande Ruins National Monument
description: An Ancestral Sonoran Desert People's farming community and "Great House" are preserved at Casa Grande Ruins. Whether a gathering place for people or simply a waypoint marker in an extensive system of canals and trading partners, the structures are a large part of the story of this site. Explore the history and stories of an extended network of communities and irrigation canals.
shortDescription: An Ancestral Sonoran Desert People's farming community and "Great House" are preserved at Casa Grande Ruins. Whether a gathering place for people or simply a waypoint marker in an extensive system of ...

operatingHours.description:
The monument is open 7 days a week, with the exception of being closed Juneteenth, Independence Day, Thanksgiving, and Christmas. 

The gate closes 15 minutes prior to closing, with access for exiting the park still available on the outgoing side.

climate.weatherDescription: Summer daytime temperatures frequently exceed 100 degrees F. Winter temperatures range from the 60's to the 80's F. Spring and fall are warm and dry, with highs in the 80's and 90's F. During summer months, be prepared for hot temperatures. Protective clothing, hats, sunscreen and personal water containers are highly recommended. BE AWARE: Walls of dirt and debris, usually miles wide and thousands of feet high, are pushed across dry desert terrain by high winds, causing dust to engulf highways.

images.title: Great House
images.altText: eathern building under modern roof structure
images.caption: The Great House at Casa Grande Ruins has existed for over 600 years.

images.title: Great House from the South
images.altText: earthern ruins including the Great House and other parts
images.caption: A highlight of Compound A is the Great House but it is not the only earthern building to intrigue visitors.

images.title: Great House in the Sonoran Desert
images.altText: earthern Great House with its roof among desert plants
images.caption: The Great House at Casa Grande Ruins is a sentinel of the desert.

images.title: Morning from the Northeast
images.altText: earthern Great House standing out in the Sonoran Desert plants
images.caption: The Great House at Casa Grande may have been an orientation point for travelers and traders.

images.title: Historic Sign
images.altText: historic copper sign with Great House and saguaro flanking
images.caption: The park's historic copper sign was relocated with roadway changes, and now sits near the visitor center.

images.title: Actors Recreating Jewelry
images.altText: child, adult female, adult male American Indian actors in costume making jewelry in movie shoot
images.caption: In this scene from the park movie, actors demonstrate jewelry making as done in ancestral times.
